Two substantial corporate developments for ADANIENT Ltd (Adani Enterprises Ltd) were reported on August 28, 2025: the approval to acquire Jaiprakash Associates and a milestone for the Adani Portfolio's TTM EBITDA .

Acquisition of Jaiprakash Associates

Adani Portfolio reaches EBITDA milestone

Approval by CCI: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) approved the Adani Group's acquisition of up to a 100% shareholding of Jaiprakash Associates Ltd (JAL).

Entities involved: The acquisition will be carried out by Adani Enterprises Ltd (AEL) and Adani Infrastructure and Developers Pvt Ltd (AIDPL).

Background: The deal is part of the corporate insolvency resolution process for JAL, which entered insolvency on June 3, 2024, after defaulting on loans.

Strategic impact: The move is viewed as a significant step in Adani's expansion within the infrastructure and real estate sectors.

Record performance: The Adani Group's consolidated trailing twelve-month (TTM) EBITDA crossed the ₹90,000 crore milestone.

Financials: The TTM EBITDA reached ₹90,572 crore for the period of July 2024 to June 2025.

Performance drivers: The growth was attributed to strong performances in core infrastructure, logistics, and green energy businesses, along with emerging airport operations.

On August 28, 2025, Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone (APSEZ) was featured in reports detailing its parent company's quarterly results .

Adani Group's overall financial performance

Specific contribution from APSEZ

Market analyst reports

The Adani Group, which includes APSEZ, announced its Q1 FY26 financial results on August 28, 2025.

The group reported its Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation, and Amortization (EBITDA) crossed the ₹90,000 crore milestone on a trailing twelve-month (TTM) basis for the first time.

Group EBITDA for the first quarter of FY26 was a record ₹23,793 crore, a 3.3% increase year-on-year.

APSEZ was identified as a key contributor to the Adani Group's strong performance.

APSEZ saw an 11% increase in cargo volumes during the quarter, reaching 120.6 million metric tonnes (MMT).

This strong performance was driven by a 19% rise in container volumes.

On the same day,NDTV Profithighlighted a Motilal Oswal report that maintained a "Buy" rating for Adani Ports, citing visible growth through capacity enhancements, infrastructure projects, and acquisitions. The report projected sustained growth beyond FY26.

On the same day,NDTV Profithighlighted a Motilal Oswal report that maintained a "Buy" rating for Adani Ports, citing visible growth through capacity enhancements, infrastructure projects, and acquisitions

No significant corporate developments for APOLLOHOSP Ltd on August 28, 2025 . News reports from that day focused on routine stock price movements and market commentary.

The most recent substantial corporate news involved the following events, which occurred before August 28, 2025:

On August 22, 2025, a block deal occurred in which promoter Suneetha Reddy sold a stake in the company. Marquee investors, including Abu Dhabi Investment Authority and T. Rowe Price, purchased shares.

Around August 24, 2025, stock analysts reiterated their positive outlook on the Indian hospital sector, including APOLLOHOSP, based on strong demand and expansion plans.

On August 14, 2025, Prabhudas Lilladher published a research report that included updates from the company's Q1 FY24/25 earnings call.

Nifty 50 performance:Asian Paints was mentioned as a top gainer on the Nifty 50 on August 28, 2025, but this was a market-wide trend, not a company-specific event.

On August 28, 2025, Bajaj Auto Ltd. was reported to be experiencing a significant production cut of its Chetak electric scooter due to a shortage of rare-earth metals . The company's market share in the electric two-wheeler segment subsequently halved in August.

Production cut of Chetak electric scooter: AnAl Jazeeraarticle, published on August 28, detailed how a global shortage of rare-earth metals forced Bajaj Auto to significantly reduce the production of its Chetak electric scooter. The article states that Bajaj produced just 10,824 Chetak units in July, nearly halving its output compared to the 20,384 units made in the same period last year.

Impact on market share: This production issue contributed to a considerable drop in Bajaj Auto's electric vehicle (EV) market share. A report published later, on September 1, indicates that the company's EV market share declined from 22% in July to 11% in August, moving it to the fifth spot in the segment. The report also mentions that rival Ather Energy saw a market share increase during the same period.

Analysts' commentary on GST: A report from Jefferies on August 28 included commentary on the potential impact of a possible Goods and Services Tax (GST) reduction on the automotive sector. While the report did not focus specifically on Bajaj Auto, it noted that two-wheelers and small passenger vehicles would likely benefit most from such a cut.

Substantial corporate developments for BEL Ltd on August 28, 2025, primarily involved shareholder-related actions, with no major operational or business strategy updates reported for that specific day .

While no other significant announcements were made by BEL on August 28, other corporate news was reported earlier in the month:

Annual General Meeting (AGM):BEL held its 71st Annual General Meeting on August 28.

Final dividend payout:The results of the AGM included the approval of a previously recommended final dividend of ₹0.90 per equity share for the 2024-2025 financial year.

AGM proceedings:The company filed the proceedings and the scrutinizer's report for the meeting with the exchanges.

August 5:BEL was highlighted as a potential beneficiary of large BrahMos missile orders from the Indian Air Force and Navy.

August 1:The company appointed three new executive directors.

According to web searches, Bharti Airtel's subsidiary, Airtel Uganda, announced a significant interim dividend on August 28, 2025 . No other substantial corporate developments for BHARTIARTL Ltd were found from that specific date.

Airtel Uganda declares interim dividend:Bharti Airtel's Ugandan subsidiary, Airtel Uganda, declared an interim dividend of Ushs 174 billion for the first half of 2025, which amounts to Ushs 4.35 per share.

The payout was driven by strong financial performance, with a 28.7% increase in profit after tax and a 12.3% rise in revenue.

The company's improved performance and robust cash flow supported this dividend distribution and ongoing network investments.

On August 28, 2025, Cipla announced the completion of two corporate developments: the acquisition of a stake in iCaltech Innovations and a product recall in the US .

Corporate developments

Completes 20% stake acquisition in iCaltech Innovations:Cipla announced that it had closed the acquisition of a 20% stake in Bengaluru-based medical device maker iCaltech Innovations Pvt Ltd. The deal, valued at approximately ₹5 crore, gives Cipla a minority holding and reinforces its presence in the respiratory care and diagnostics sector.

Voluntary product recall in the US:An arm of Cipla, Cipla USA Inc., is voluntarily recalling over 20,000 packs of Ibuterol Sulfate Inhalation Aerosol in the US market. The product is a medication used to treat asthma and certain types of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.

Multiple substantial corporate developments for COALINDIA Ltd were announced on August 28, 2025 .

Changes to leadership:The company announced several changes to its senior management and Board of Directors.

Shri Asheesh Kumar was appointed Director (Business Development) to the Board.

The company announced that Shri Asheesh Kumar ceased to be an Additional Director.

S. K. Maimud Alli was appointed as an Executive Director.

Annual General Meeting (AGM):The 51st Annual General Meeting was held, where shareholders voted on a final dividend of ₹5.15 per share for FY25.

Expansion into critical minerals:During the AGM, the chairman announced that Coal India is expanding into the critical minerals sector.

They have been the preferred bidder for two domestic graphite blocks.

They signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with IREL (India) Ltd. to explore critical minerals, including rare earth elements.

The company is also evaluating potential lithium assets in Australia for acquisition through a joint venture with KABIL.

Roadshows for subsidiary IPOs:Coal India plans to hold roadshows for the initial public offerings (IPOs) of its subsidiaries, Bharat Coking Coal Ltd (BBCL) and Central Mine Planning & Design Institute Ltd (CMPDI).

On August 28, 2025, Dr. Reddy's Laboratories made an announcement regarding the allotment of Employee Stock Options (ESOPs) . The company released a regulatory filing disclosing the allotment of these equity shares.

Additional context regarding the announcement:

The announcement was made via a regulatory filing with the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

While this is a corporate development, it is generally considered a routine and non-material event in the context of major business updates. It does not reflect on significant business strategy, mergers, acquisitions, or major product launches.

On August 28, 2025, BNP Paribas reportedly bought over 100 million shares of ETERNAL Ltd for approximately ₹3,220 crore . This was described as a large-scale "block deal" in the stock. While the searches found no announcements directly from ETERNAL Ltd. on this date, this significant institutional buying activity was a major corporate news item reported by financial news sources.

This news is considered a substantial corporate development because:

Significant investment:The large size of the transaction indicates a major investment in ETERNAL Ltd. by a prominent financial institution.

Investor confidence:Such a large purchase by an institutional investor is often interpreted by the market as a vote of confidence in the company's prospects.

Potential market impact:The scale of the deal is substantial enough to have a notable effect on market sentiment and ETERNAL's share performance, separating it from routine trading activity.

According to corporate filings on August 28, 2025, Grasim Industries made two substantial announcements: the appointment of a new secretarial auditor and the publication of results from its Annual General Meeting .

Appointment of Secretarial Auditor:Grasim announced the appointment of a new secretarial auditor for five consecutive years, as reported by BSE.

Annual General Meeting (AGM) results:The company published the scrutinizer's report and voting results for its 78th Annual General Meeting.

On August 28, 2025, HCLTech, in partnership with Pearson India and the MeitY Startup Hub, launched the national initiative "ARISE FOR YOU™" . The program is designed to promote innovation and entrepreneurship among young people in India.

Target audience: Student entrepreneurs across India.

Expected participation: Over 150,000 students from more than 3,000 campuses are anticipated to participate.

Key activities: Participants will take part in an innovation and entrepreneurship challenge.

Outcome: The initiative will culminate in a grand finale in March 2026, where winning teams will be eligible for grants and incubation opportunities.

Partner contributions:

MeitY Startup Hub: Will provide access to its innovation ecosystem and offer mentorship.

Pearson India: Will provide an Entrepreneurship and Small Business (ESB) certification and learning materials.

The following are substantial corporate developments for HDFC Bank Ltd. published on August 28, 2025 :

Global emerging markets (EM) fund ownership

HDFC Bank allotted 767.7 crore bonus shares in a 1:1 ratio to eligible shareholders, effectively doubling the bank's equity base.

The record date for determining eligible shareholders was August 27, 2025.

Following the allotment, the bank's paid-up share capital increased to ₹1,535.4 crore.

This was the first bonus issue in the bank's history and is seen as an indicator of management's confidence in liquidity and trading volumes.

According to a Copley Fund Research analysis, HDFC Bank has cemented its position as the most important emerging market bank in global portfolios.

It is now held by 71% of all actively managed EM funds, the highest representation in the research firm's 17-year history.

This is attributed to the bank's increased strategic significance following its 2023 merger with its parent company, Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC).

No significant corporate developments for HDFCLIFE Ltd on August 28, 2025 . Search results for this date reveal only routine market commentary, including daily stock price fluctuations, trading volume, and market performance.

News published on dates immediately preceding or following August 28, 2025, includes:

August 29, 2025:A news article mentions a partnership between HDFC Life and Avanse Financial Services to provide group credit life insurance to educational institutions, with reports also published on September 1, 2025.

August 30, 2025:A report on Simply Wall Street notes that HDFC Bank is the largest shareholder of HDFC Life.

On August 28, 2025, Jefferies upgraded HEROMOTOCO Ltd. to a "Hold" rating from "Underperform," forecasting increased demand for two-wheelers due to a potential Goods and Services Tax (GST) cut . While this is primarily market commentary based on an external factor, it is a noteworthy event since it reflects a significant change in an analyst's view regarding the company's future earnings.

The brokerage raised its price target for Hero MotoCorp to Rs 5,200 from Rs 3,800.

Jefferies stated that a GST reduction would benefit two-wheelers and small passenger vehicles most significantly.

The upgrade was tempered by ongoing concerns about Hero MotoCorp's declining market share.

On August 28, 2025, Hindalco Industries announced plans to invest ₹586 crore in a new aluminium extrusion facility in Kuppam, Andhra Pradesh, to produce components for Apple iPhones . The new plant will manufacture the primary raw material for mobile phone chassis, supporting Apple's supply chain in India.

Key details of the announcement:

The project was approved by Andhra Pradesh's State Investment Promotion Board.

Commercial production is expected to begin by March 2027.

The facility is projected to create over 600 jobs in four years.

This move aligns with India's "Make in India" initiative and expands the country's technology manufacturing capabilities.

On August 28, 2025, Hindustan Unilever (HINDUNILVR) issued a Postal Ballot Notice seeking shareholder approval for the appointment of Ms. Priya Nair as the new Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer . Ms. Nair's appointment had been previously announced in July, with an effective date of August 1, 2025.

The company also published the following business updates on its official website on August 28, 2025:

"Partner to Win" program: HUL highlighted its flagship "Partner to Win" (PTW) program, which aims to improve collaboration with suppliers and partners on innovation, sustainability, and growth.

Sunsilk relaunch: An article detailed the relaunch of the Sunsilk brand, which aimed to refresh its identity to resonate with a new generation of consumers.

The following are significant corporate developments for ICICIBANK Ltd reported on August 28, 2025:

Senior Management Change: The bank's Board accepted the early retirement request from Subir Saha, the Group Chief Compliance Officer (GCCO), effective at the close of business hours on August 28, 2025. Anish Madhavan, a current Senior Management Personnel (SMP), was appointed as the new GCCO, effective August 29, 2025.

Minimum Balance Hike and Industry Impact: ALivemintarticle highlighted ICICI Bank's decision to raise its minimum balance requirement. The article discussed how this move, along with similar actions by other private banks, was seen as a strategic response to a deposit crunch in the Indian banking sector.

Equity Share Allotment: The bank allotted 68,621 equity shares under an employee stock option scheme (ESOS). This is a regular corporate action, but the specific allotment was reported on this date.

On August 28, 2025, IndusInd Bank's shareholders rejected a proposal that would have allowed promoters to nominate an additional director to the board . The news of this vote, which took place during the bank's Annual General Meeting (AGM) on that day, was widely reported by news outlets. The rejected resolution was voted down by 54% of shareholders, despite having received prior approval from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI).

Promoter institution IndusInd International Holdings (IIHL) expressed disappointment with the vote, stating they would work to clear up what they called a "misinterpretation" by proxy advisors. While this resolution failed, shareholders did approve the appointment of Rajiv Anand as the new MD and CEO, and other resolutions were also passed.

Contextual information This development follows other corporate changes and news earlier in August, including:

CEO change:Rajiv Anand had already formally taken charge as the new Managing Director and CEO on August 25, 2025, following his earlier appointment by the RBI.

AGM announcement:The 31st Annual General Meeting was scheduled for August 29, 2025.

Q1 results:Earlier in July, the bank reported a decline in Q1 FY26 net profit and faced scrutiny over asset quality.

On August 28, 2025, On August 28, 2025,Infosysannounced a significant corporate development with its strategic collaboration with Mastercard .

Infosys entered into a partnership with Mastercard to scale cross-border payments. The collaboration is focused on enhancing access for financial institutions to Mastercard Move, Mastercard's portfolio of money movement capabilities.

Key details of the collaboration include:

Infosys will integrate its digital banking suite, Finacle (from its subsidiary EdgeVerve Systems), with Mastercard Move.

This integration is designed to provide financial institutions with a more efficient and faster pathway to access Mastercard Move's capabilities.

It is expected to reduce the typical implementation time and resourcing needed for such integration projects.

On August 28, 2025,Infosysannounced a significant corporate development with its strategic collaboration with Mastercard

On August 28, 2025, On August 28, 2025,Jio Financial Services (JIOFIN)held its Second Annual General Meeting (AGM) and made several substantial corporate announcements .

Key corporate developments from the AGM:

Expansion of business strategy:At the AGM, chairman K.V. Kamath emphasized that the 2024-2025 fiscal year was pivotal for scaling the business, securing regulatory approvals, and forming new partnerships. The company highlighted ambitious expansion plans for its financial services.

Launch of "Savings Pro":Its subsidiary, Jio Payments Bank, announced it would launch "Savings Pro," a new savings account that automatically invests idle funds into overnight mutual funds for higher returns. The product is described as a first in India.

Digital innovation:JIOFIN revealed it had implemented an advanced data intelligence engine during FY25, which will underpin personalized and intelligent financial services for its customers.

Update on partnerships:The company provided updates on its existing strategic partnerships with global financial players like BlackRock and Allianz.

Lending business growth:JIOFIN announced significant growth in its lending business, with its Assets Under Management (AUM) rising to ₹11,665 crore.

First-ever dividend:The company's board approved its first-ever dividend payment for the 2024-25 fiscal year, following its post-listing AGM. The dividend record date was previously set for August 11, 2025.

Appointment of auditor:An appointment of a secretarial auditor was also disclosed on this day.

On August 28, 2025,Jio Financial Services (JIOFIN)held its Second Annual General Meeting (AGM) and made several substantial corporate announcements

According to web searches, JSW Steel announced the incorporation of a joint venture company on August 28, 2025, to develop an iron ore project in Andhra Pradesh . This was considered a top corporate update by some financial news sources on that day.

Joint venture incorporation: JSW Steel completed the incorporation of APJSW Private Limited, a joint venture with the Andhra Pradesh Mineral Development Corporation (APMDC).

Purpose of the joint venture: The new entity will develop the Konijedu Marlapadu Integrated Iron Ore Project, with the goal of producing 1.3 million tons of beneficiated iron ore concentrate annually.

Strategic importance: This project is intended to enhance the company's raw material security, replace imported iron ore, and reduce costs.

Ownership structure: JSW Steel holds an 89% stake in the joint venture, with APMDC holding the remaining 11%.

The searches identified one substantial corporate development for M&M Ltd published on August 28, 2025 .

Substantial corporate development

Airbus H125 fuselage contract:Mahindra Aerostructures, a subsidiary of the Mahindra Group, was awarded a new contract by Airbus Helicopters to manufacture and assemble the main fuselage for the H125 helicopter. The announcement stated that manufacturing would begin immediately, with the first delivery expected in 2027. This was the second such contract received from Airbus, reflecting a strengthened partnership and reinforcing the "Make in India" initiative.

For Maruti Suzuki India Ltd. on August 28, 2025, there were several significant corporate developments announced during the company's 44th Annual General Meeting (AGM) .

Expansion into new business areas: The company's shareholders approved changes to its Memorandum of Association to allow it to enter new segments, including EV charging infrastructure, integrated mobility services, carbon credit trading, and vehicle recycling.

Alternative fuel focus: During the AGM, the company's chairman, RC Bhargava, reiterated Maruti Suzuki's strategy to focus on a variety of alternative fuels, including CNG, hybrids, and biogas, alongside EVs. This approach is based on the belief that mass EV adoption in India still faces significant hurdles.

Gujarat plant investment: Nomura reported that Maruti Suzuki plans to invest ₹70,000 crore over the next 5-6 years to scale the Gujarat plant to a capacity of one million units.

Vehicle launches and production:

Start of EV production: Prime Minister Narendra Modi marked the start of production for Maruti Suzuki's first battery electric vehicle (BEV), the e VITARA, at the Suzuki Motor Gujarat plant. The e VITARA is slated for export to over 100 countries, positioning India as a global EV manufacturing hub for Suzuki.

Export-first strategy: The company is prioritizing export requirements for the new e VITARA before its domestic launch.

New C-SUV: News outlets reported that Maruti Suzuki is expected to launch a new C-SUV on September 3, 2025, which will be retailed through its Arena dealership network.

Supply chain and GST: At the AGM, Bhargava advocated for a reduction in GST rates on small cars to counter the impact of U.S. tariffs on other Indian industries.

AGM resolutions passed: Shareholders approved all resolutions, including the re-appointment of directors, the appointment of new auditors, and the declaration of a dividend.

Key appointments confirmed:

Mr. Kenichiro Toyofuku was re-appointed as the Whole-time Director for Sustainability.

Mr. Koichi Suzuki was appointed as a new Director.

The following are the significant corporate developments for NESTLEIND Ltd on August 28, 2025 :

Virtual meet with an institutional investor:The company conducted a one-on-one virtual meeting with an institutional investor on August 28, 2025, to provide general updates. No unpublished price-sensitive information was shared during the meeting.

Global product and growth updates:While not specific to Nestle India's immediate local market, the parent company, Nestlé, published several global updates around this time that offer context on the company's broader business strategy. In late July and August 2025, Nestlé announced:

The launch of a high-protein Milo Pro for young adults.

The expansion of Nescafé Espresso Concentrate production in Malaysia to meet rising demand for cold coffee.

H1-2025 financial results showing consistent execution and improving growth foundations, along with maintaining its 2025 guidance.

Significant corporate developments for NTPC Ltd on August 28, 2025, included a project cost revision, the transfer of a business segment to a subsidiary, and news of a joint venture for a new power plant .

Rammam-III Hydroelectric Project cost revised NTPC's Board of Directors approved more than doubling the estimated cost of the Rammam-III Hydroelectric Power Project (HEPP) to $2,865.56 crore. The 120 MW project, located in Darjeeling, West Bengal, was originally approved in 2014 at a cost of $1,381.84 crore. The expected completion date has also been delayed by nearly a decade, with a new target of March 2029.

Transfer of coal mining business to subsidiary The company's board approved a partial modification to the transfer of its coal mining business to its fully-owned subsidiary, NTPC Mining Ltd (NML).

New power plant in Odisha with NALCO and Coal India National Aluminium Company (NALCO) announced it would join a joint venture with NTPC and Coal India to set up a new power plant in Angul, Odisha. The project is valued at $12,000 crore ($1.44 billion).

The business, which contributed $7,735.54 crore in revenue in FY25, will be moved under an amended Business Transfer Agreement (BTA).

The transfer comes with a consideration of $10,503.27 crore, which will be paid by NML to NTPC in phases.

On August 28, 2025, ONGC confirmed the commencement of natural gas sales from the Chinnewala Tibba field in Rajasthan . Production from the Discovered Small Field (DSF-II) block RJ/ONDSF/Chinnewala/2018 officially began on August 25, with a daily output of 100,000 standard cubic meters.

This is considered a substantial corporate development as it marks the successful monetization of the field and helps reinforce India's domestic energy production.

Key details of the project include:

Location: The field is in the Rajasthan Kutch Onland Exploratory Asset (RKOEA), near the Indo-Pakistan border.

Gas supply: The gas is being supplied to the Rajasthan Rajya Vidyut Utpadan Nigam Limited (RRVUNL) via ONGC's Gamnewala Gas Collection Station.

Strategic importance: The project is aligned with the Ministry of Petroleum & Natural Gas's goal of strengthening the country's energy security.

On August 28, 2025, POWERGRID Ltd. had two significant corporate developments . The company announced a major project win in Karnataka and convened its 36th Annual General Meeting (AGM).

POWERGRID was declared the successful bidder for a new inter-state transmission system (ISTS) project in Karnataka.

The company also held its 36th AGM via video conferencing on August 26, 2025, and announced the details of the meeting on August 28.

Project purpose:The new transmission system is intended to strengthen the grid in Davanagere to integrate renewable energy generation.

Operating model:POWERGRID will develop, own, operate, and transfer the project under the Build, Own, Operate and Transfer (BOOT) model.

Official letter:The Letter of Intent (LoI) for the project was received by the company on August 27, 2025.

Key highlights:During the meeting, management reviewed the company's financial performance, operational achievements, future growth strategies, and technological initiatives.

Shareholder approval:All resolutions proposed at the AGM were approved by the shareholders.

The primary news regarding substantial corporate developments for Reliance Industries Ltd. was released on August 29, 2025 , following its 48th Annual General Meeting (AGM).

While searches on August 28, 2025, showed some minor, non-material updates like stock price movements, the key corporate announcements that fall under the requested criteria were made the following day at the AGM. On August 28, 2025, investors were anticipating these developments.

Jio IPO planned:Reliance plans to list its telecom and digital services arm, Jio Platforms, in the first half of 2026.

Launch of Reliance Intelligence:A new subsidiary, Reliance Intelligence, was announced to drive artificial intelligence initiatives across all Reliance businesses.

Strategic AI partnerships:The company revealed partnerships with Meta and Google Cloud to develop and scale AI services.

New Energy expansion:Updated plans for the Dhirubhai Ambani Giga Energy Complex in Jamnagar were shared, including the expansion of solar capacity and the establishment of battery and electrolyser factories by 2026.

Retail growth and restructuring:The consumer products division was restructured, with Reliance Consumer Products Ltd (RCPL) becoming a direct subsidiary. The company also announced a ₹40,000 crore investment to establish Asia's largest food parks.

Tata Motors Ltd. published one significant corporate development on August 28, 2025: the allotment of new shares to employees . This came a few days after another substantial development on August 25, 2025, which saw the National Company Law Tribunal sanction the company's major restructuring plan.

August 28, 2025: Allotment of ESOP shares

Preceding significant news

Action:Tata Motors allotted 3,06,071 ordinary/equity shares to eligible employees under its Share-based Long Term Incentive Scheme 2021.

Details:The shares were issued as a result of employees exercising their Performance Share Units and Stock Options.

Effect:This action increased the company's paid-up equity share capital.

August 25, 2025: NCLT sanctions restructuring scheme

The National Company Law Tribunal approved the "Composite Scheme of Arrangement" for the demerger of Tata Motors' commercial and passenger vehicle businesses.

Here are the significant corporate developments for Tata Steel Ltd on August 28, 2025 .

Employee bonus payout:Tata Steel announced a total bonus payout of ₹303.13 crore for its employees for the 2024–25 financial year, following a settlement with the workers' union in Jamshedpur.

Investment in Singapore subsidiary:The company invested ₹3,100 crore by acquiring shares in its Singapore-based subsidiary, T Steel Holdings Pte Ltd. The investment is intended to support the subsidiary's ongoing operations and expansion plans.

Brokerage expectations:In a report, brokerage Emkay highlighted Tata Steel and SAIL as its top picks in the steel sector. Emkay analysts expect the company to achieve an upside of up to 29%.

Market positioning:The report also noted that integrated players like Tata Steel are well-positioned to benefit from evolving government policies and a shift in market dynamics.

Significant corporate developments for TCS Ltd on August 28, 2025, included a new partnership with Unilab and the formation of a dedicated Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Services Transformation unit .

Partnership with Unilab:TCS announced a partnership with Unilab, a major pharmaceutical and healthcare company in the Philippines, for a cloud-led enterprise modernization project. The project will involve migrating Unilab's legacy ERP system to a modern, cloud-based digital core using SAP S/4HANA on RISE.

Launch of new AI unit:TCS established a dedicated AI and Services Transformation unit, consolidating its existing AI capabilities to accelerate innovation and develop more specific solutions for client industries. Amit Kapur, previously head of TCS's UK and Ireland business, was appointed to lead the new unit.

Large office lease in Bengaluru:TCS signed one of Bengaluru's largest commercial space leases, taking 1.4 million sq ft of office space in Electronic City. The 15-year lease is valued at approximately $255 million and is part of a wider expansion plan.

On August 28, 2025, a significant corporate development for the Mahindra Group was announced, involving its aerospace business . While not directly a TECHM Ltd. announcement, the news involves the broader Mahindra conglomerate, which often generates interest in its various group companies.

Mahindra Aerostructures, a subsidiary of the Mahindra Group, was awarded a contract by Airbus to manufacture the main fuselage for the H125 helicopter.

Manufacturing location:The H125 fuselages will be produced at Mahindra's Bengaluru facility, which is being expanded for this specific program.

First delivery timeline:Industrialization will start immediately, with the first fuselage delivery targeted for 2027.

Strategic importance:This deal further strengthens the relationship between Airbus and Mahindra and demonstrates India's growing role in global aerospace manufacturing.

Mahindra's broader role:Mahindra Aerostructures already supplies various components, sub-assemblies, and complex aerostructures to Airbus for other global programs.
